Dear Dr. Moss:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 punched Youth A multiple times during a physical
altercation.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 01/04/2024 and no
additional information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 01/04/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility. Youth A
stated the incident in question began when he and Youth B had
wanted to try to escape the facility by pulling the fire alarm. Youth
A recalled the plan unfolding when he did not return to his
bedroom when asked by staff. Youth B then pulled the fire alarm
in the unit and attempted to take Staff 1’s keys. Youth A stated
both he and Staff 1 got more upset at each other, as they were
both yelling and threatening, while Youth A tried to get Staff 1’s
keys. Youth A stated he threw the first punch at Staff 1 as things
escalated physically. Youth A stated Staff 1 then punched back at
him approximately three times; Youth A was hit in the face on two
of those punches. Youth A then fell backward to the ground and
recalled Staff 1 then putting a knee on his side to hold him down.
He also recalled someone holding his arm back behind him, but
he could not remember who this was. Youth A stated he got up
on his own after about a minute and he got back in Staff 1’s face,
but at that point the physical interaction between them ended.
Youth B was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 01/04/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility. He stated
the incident in question began because he and Youth A decided to
attempt to break out of the facility. Youth B stated he had pulled
the fire alarm in an attempt to distract staff and Youth A then
attempted to get the keys away from Staff 1. Youth B recalled
seeing Youth A and Staff 1 have their fists balled up and then
Youth A swung at Staff 1 in an attempt to punch him. Youth B
then saw Staff 1 swing back at Youth A. Youth A then fell to the
ground and Youth B saw Staff 1 standing over him throwing more
2

punches. Youth B stated he did not see much else between
Youth A and Staff 1 because Staff 2 then attempted to restrain
him as a result of the physical aggression he was showing
towards Staff 1. Youth B stated he bit Staff 2 and tried to kick him
while this occurred as a way to get out of the restraint, and Staff 2
released him.
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 01/24/2024
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. Staff 2
recalled the incident in question. He stated things escalated when
Youth A and Youth B were outside of their bedrooms and had
Staff 1 cornered in the common area of the unit. Staff 2
immediately recognized that the youth were either going to
attempt to assault Staff 1 or try to steal his keys because of their
posturing and what they were saying. Staff 2 recalled seeing
Youth A punch Staff 1 in the face. Staff 2 could not recall exactly
what happened next because he saw both Youth A and Youth B
lunge at Staff 1, so he decided to attempt to restrain Youth B as
he was nearest to Staff 2. Staff 2 stated he had his hands on
Youth B’s upper arms from behind while standing. Youth B then
attempted to kick him and reached over and bit Staff 2’s hands.
Staff 2 recalled letting go of Youth B at that point and moving
away from him. Staff 2 stated he was able to see Youth A on the
ground with Staff 1 standing over top of him. Staff 2 believed that
was the last he saw of Staff 1 and Youth A interacting. Staff 2
stated he was very upset at that point in time because he thought
there was good rapport between he and both Youth A and Youth
B and their behavior was why he reacted so significantly as
evidenced in the video footage.
Staff 3 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 01/24/2024 over
the phone during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility.
Staff 3 stated he was present for the incident in question, but he
was not directly involved. He recalled seeing the events unfold
while on the other end of the unit. He recalled Youth A refusing to
go to his room and then a physical interaction between Youth A
and Staff 1. Staff 3 could not recall any specifics regarding
punches thrown or who said what to each other.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/31/2024 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. Staff 1 recalled the incident in question. He stated
everything began with Youth A and Youth B escalating and
refusing to go to bed on the evening of 01/01/2024. Staff 1
recalled Youth A and Youth B talking to each other in hushed
tones, and Staff 1 was concerned they were planning something.
He recalled Youth A attempting to pick the lock to the back exit
3

door of the unit with a belt, and Staff 1 was able to take that from
Youth A without incident. Staff 1 stated Youth A and Youth B then
approached him and Youth A asked for Staff 1’s keys. Youth A
stated to Staff 1 he was going to “beat his ass.” Staff 1 recalled
Youth A stated to Youth B “What you on? I’m on the same one
you on” and Staff 1 interpreted that as a planned attack on staff or
an attempt to escape. Staff 1 recalled Youth B then throwing a
punch at him, with Youth A then doing the same. Staff 1 stated he
punched back and hit Youth A in the chest. He then recalled Staff
2 going hands on with Youth B, and not seeing what occurred with
them following the restraint attempt. Staff 1 recalled Youth A
falling to the ground. Staff 1 believed he hit Youth A two or three
times while taking punches back from him. Staff 1 recalled the
situation then quickly calmed down after Youth A got back up and
he stepped away from Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 confirmed no
one had their hands on another person after that point.
During a video conference held on 02/06/2024, DHHS Worker 1
stated that their investigation would produce findings and Staff 1
would be confirmed.
Documents reviewed:
• Documentation was provided to show that Staff 1 was
suspended from employment as of 01/03/2024.
• Documentation of staff training was provided and showed
that both Staff 1 and Staff 2 were fully certified in the
restraint model approved for the facility as of 11/09/2023.
• No discipline was noted in either of Staff 1 or Staff 2’s
personnel file.
• Two “Critical Incident Report” documents both dated
01/02/2024 were provided. Both state that restraint holds
were used separately on Youth A and Youth B in the
course of the youth attempting to assault staff.
• Video footage from the evening of 01/01/2024 was
provided and reviewed. It was seen in this footage that the
fire alarm had been set off and Youth A and Youth B were
outside of their bedrooms. No other youth were seen in
this footage. Youth A, Youth B and Staff 1 are obscured
from view while the incident occurred. These three
individuals were near the lower wall of the unit, which is
where a door exiting the building is located. The camera
that best captured what occurred is mounted on that same
wall. Staff 2 can be seen moving away from Youth A,
Youth B and Staff 1 against that wall, and then moving
quickly back toward them. The first instance of seeing Staff
1 and Youth A engaged physically then occurred. Staff 3 is
4

seen to the right of Staff 2, who then backs up a few feet.
Staff 1 was then seen over the top of Youth A as Youth A
was falling to the ground. Staff 1 appeared to punch down
at Youth A multiple times. All the individuals involved are
then obscured from view again for 20 seconds. Staff 2 was
then seen moving away from everyone else and he flipped
a nearby chair and was visibly upset. Staff 3 was then
seen standing and looking towards the other obscured
individuals and appeared calm.
o Time stamps were not available for the footage, but
the start time of approximately 11:16pm was
consistent with information provided by the Chief
Administrator and other documentation.
o Separate footage was provided from a security
camera on the opposite side of the common area of
the unit. Individuals can be seen physically engaged
but the footage was not clear enough, not close
enough and somewhat obscured by a corner wall for
more detail to be determined.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff and documentation and
video footage reviewed, there was evidence found to show a rule
violation in that Staff 1 punched back at Youth A during the
escalated incident.
Technical Assistance provided:
• More detail is needed in the writing of Incident Reports
when describing escalated incidents and the use of
physical management.
Consultation provided:
• The facility was advised to consider the addition of one
more camera within the units that would allow for better
coverage of all areas of the unit.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or
otherwise suggesting physical or emotional harm
to a youth.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
5

Allegation Staff 1 used threatening language towards youth during an
escalated incident.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 01/04/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility. Youth A
recalled “getting in the face” of Staff 1 and asking for his keys.
Youth A recalled Staff 1 saying “Get your bitch ass out of my face”
in response. Youth A believed Staff 1 spit in his face when saying
this, but Youth A believed this was not on purpose but more of an
accident because of how upset Staff 1 was getting. Youth A
recalled Staff 1 also stating “Swing on me again so I can beat your
ass again” after there were punches exchanged between them.
Youth B was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 01/04/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility. Youth B
recalled Youth A and Staff 1 yelling at each other but could not
remember exactly what was said. Youth B then stated he did hear
Staff 1 state “Go ahead and swing on me so I can beat your ass”
before any punches were thrown.
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 01/24/2024
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. Staff 2
heard both Youth A and Youth B say “You know what time it is”
and “Take his keys.” Staff 2 recalled hearing Staff 1 state
something to the effect of “Hold on guys, let’s calm down” in
response. Staff 2 also heard Youth A threaten Staff 1. Staff 2
recalled saying something to the effect of “Please don’t do nothing
silly, you’re good kids.” Staff 2 recalled hearing Staff 1 escalate
with Youth A, with Staff 1 stating “Do something” and using a
racial slur to Youth A while stepping very close to him.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/31/2024 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. Staff 1 recalled the incident in question. Staff 1 did not
recall much of what was said during the incident. He did recall
stating to Youth A something to the effect of “If you run up on me
…” and “Hit me if you want, something’s going to happen.” Staff 1
denied cussing at either Youth A or Youth B.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Employee Standards of Conduct and
Performance” was reviewed. In this policy it is stated that
“Employees are forbidden from using excessive physical
force or verbal abuse of students.”
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff there was evidence to
support a finding that Staff 1 used language that was threatening
and suggested harm to the youth while interacting with them.
6

Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
